docs.snippet: The case for a conservative politics that stresses the national interest abroad and national solidarity at home....
docs.lead_paragraph: The case for a conservative politics that stresses the national interest abroad and national solidarity at home.
docs.abstract: Campaign Stops column by Ross Douthat and Reihan Salam considers what Republican Party should offer voters who are drawn to Donald Trump's candidacy, who is expected to lose in general election, in order to prevent rise of similar candidate in 2020; suggests best way for Republicans to fully recover is to offer policies that prove it is capable of dealing with host of challenges that face nation.

byline.original: By ROSS DOUTHAT and REIHAN SALAM

docs.snippet: If Donald J. Trump wins the White House, he would have the opportunity to lead a Republican Party with a fundamentally different character....
docs.lead_paragraph: If Donald J. Trump wins the White House, he would have the opportunity to lead a Republican Party with a fundamentally different character.

headline.main: Republicans Brace for a Clash of Visions Over Party’s Future

docs.snippet: The phrase has two meanings, and that difference is at the center of election 2016....
docs.lead_paragraph: The phrase has two meanings, and that difference is at the center of election 2016.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column argues nationalist worldview espoused by Donald Trump and his followers is backlash against rising globalist mindset that United States has responsibility to take care of immigrants and other non-citizens; argues way out of debate is return to American nationalism that combines willingness to accept outsiders with commitment to assimilate them.

headline.main: We Take Care of Our Own
headline.print_headline: We  Take Care  of Our Own

docs.snippet: The potential for clashes at the Republican convention is high. The Cleveland police can avoid them by working with protest leaders....
docs.lead_paragraph: The potential for clashes at the Republican convention is high. The Cleveland police can avoid them by working with protest leaders.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by former Seattle Police Chief Norm Stamper offers advice to Cleveland Police Dept on how to avoid clashes with protesters during Republican National Convention; says mistakes made while overseeing response to 1999 protests against World Trade Organization in Seattle have formed his perspective; urges clear communication with public and protest groups, and use of riot gear only as last resort.

headline.main: How to Prevent Violence in Cleveland
headline.print_headline: How to Prevent Violence in Cleveland

docs.snippet: Donald Trump’s embrace of economic policies that are anathema to members of the Business Roundtable is seen as a betrayal of bedrock Republican principles....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump’s embrace of economic policies that are anathema to members of the Business Roundtable is seen as a betrayal of bedrock Republican principles.
docs.abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column says Business Roundtable, with its pro-business, pro-growth economic policies, is feeling betrayed by economic positions of Hillary Rodham Clinton and Donald J Trump; points out Trump's antagonism toward trade agreements is repugnant to Roundtable.

headline.main: For Trump, Business Leaders Are More Elites to Resist
headline.print_headline: The Business Elite Is Feeling Betrayed
